com.infostretch.labs.plugins

Class Plugins

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.infostretch.labs.plugins.Plugins
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnsiblePlaybookBuilder, Ant, ArtifactArchiver, BatchFile, CheckStylePublisher, Git, JUnitResultArchiver, Mailer, Maven, NpmPackagesBuildWrapper, Shell, TestNG

    public abstract class Plugins
extends java.lang.Object
    Super class for plugins. This class is extended by every plugin whose transformation support is to be added. Common functionalities that can be used by all plugins for transformation are also included here.
    Author:
    Mohit Dharamshi

    • Constructor Detail

      • Plugins

        public Plugins(Transformer transformer,
               org.w3c.dom.Node node)
        Parameterized constructor. This will be invoked by super() in each plugin class. This constructor is implemented in plugin classes that will be performing transformations.
        Parameters:
        transformer - Transformer instance whose variables need to be read and written to.
        node - Node block from which the properties are to be read and converted.

      • Plugins

        public Plugins()
        Default constructor. This is implemented in plugin classes that do not need transformer and node variables for particular methods. Such methods will handle non-transformation actions such as pushJenkinsfile.

    • Method Detail

      • pushJenkinsfile

        public void pushJenkinsfile(java.io.File workSpace,
                            java.lang.String script,
                            java.lang.String url,
                            java.lang.String branchName,
                            java.lang.String commitMessage,
                            org.eclipse.jgit.transport.CredentialsProvider credentialsProvider)
        Method to be overridden by subclass when pushing Jenkinsfile. Clone the repo, add Jenkinsfile and push to SCM.
        Parameters:
        workSpace - The temporary workspace where the repo will be cloned.
        script - Groovy script to be written in Jenkinsfile.
        url - URL of SCM repository where Jenkinsfile is to be pushed.
        branchName - Branch of SCM where Jenkinsfile is to be pushed.
        commitMessage - Commit message to be included in commit when pushing Jenkinsfile.
        credentialsProvider - Credentials to use for clone and push operations.

      • writeCPSFlow

        public org.w3c.dom.Element writeCPSFlow(org.w3c.dom.Document dest,
                                        java.lang.String scmURL,
                                        java.lang.String branchName,
                                        java.lang.String scmCredentialsId)
        Write CPS Flow XML structure for SCM type defined.
        Parameters:
        dest - Document object in which the new XML elements are to be defined.
        scmURL - URL of SCM where new pipeline job will point for Jenkinsfile.
        branchName - Branch name of SCM where new pipeline job will point for Jenkinsfile.
        scmCredentialsId - Credentials id to use to checkout Jenkinsfile by new pipeline job.
        Returns:
        Element object definition with XML

      • getPluginClass

        public static final java.lang.Class getPluginClass(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Returns Class that matches nodeName. The method checks if any node nodeNames need to be ignored. For valid nodeNames; PluginClass enum is checked for known values. If found within PluginClass enum, the corresponding Class is derived. If PluginClass enum does not have a valid entry; then the assumption is that the last word of the fully qualified class name in the nodeName matches a class that exists in com.infostretch.labs.plugins package. If none of the above 2 scenarios suffice; then this plugin does not support the plugin that corresponds to the nodeName.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The node name whose plugin class needs to be found.
        Returns:
        Returns Class that matches nodeName.
